lead_paragraph: HAGERMAN--Peter S.,76, of Mendham, New Jersey died Wednesday, January 6, after a valiant battle with cancer. Born in East Orange, New Jersey, he was the son of the late Helen and Stephen T. Hagerman. Peter was a graduate of Columbia High School in Maplewood, New Jersey. Later, as member of the Class of 1961 of The School of Business Administration at Lehigh University in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, he received a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration. He later achieved a Master of Science in Business Administration from New York University. As a dedicated alumnus, Peter established an endowed scholarship fund, funded several student scholarships in the College of Business Administration and, with another classmate, created the highly successful and increasingly influential Endowment for Teaching of Ethical DecisionMaking at Lehigh. Peter was awarded the Eugene G. Grace Class of 1889 Award for distinguished service to the University's Planned Giving Program, as well as the prestigious Packard Award for outstanding service to the University. His name was recently inscribed on Lehigh's Leadership Plaza of the Alumni Memorial Building. Starting his career at E.F. Hutton & Company Inc., he later founded Hallmark Capital Management, a successful investment management firm, where he was the President for many years. Peter often remarked that his profession was also his hobby. After his retirement, Peter remained involved with Hallmark as Vice Chairman. Peter was named a Five Star Wealth Manager by New Jersey Monthly Magazine from 2012 through 2015. Peter is survived by his son, Stephen James Hagerman, of Denver, Colorado, his daughter Christine A. Hagerman, of Randolph, New Jersey and his beloved grandchildren, James and Sarah, also of Randolph, New Jersey. In addition, he is survived by his sister, Judith Gould, of Forest Hill, Maryland, his niece, Deborah Scott of Lititz, Pennsylvania and his nephew David Bergman, of Phoenix, Maryland. He will also be remembered by countless friends and business associates as a devoted professional, mentor and friend. The family held a private funeral service. In his memory, Peter requested that memorial donations be made to Lehigh University, Advancement Office, 27 Memorial Drive West, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania 18015. 1/3
